Class AuthController

java.lang.Object
controller.BaseController
controller.AuthController
public class AuthController extends BaseController
Authentication controller responsible for validating login credentials and managing in-memory password store used by the demo application.

This controller provides authentication services for all user types in the system:

  • Students (authenticated by student ID)
  • Company Representatives (authenticated by email)
  • Career Center Staff (authenticated by staff ID)
Security Note: This implementation uses simple in-memory password mapping with plain-text storage and is intended for demo/testing only. Production systems should use secure hashed storage with proper salting and key derivation.

  • Constructor Details

    • AuthController

      public AuthController()
      No-argument constructor used for lightweight instantiation in tests.

      Creates an AuthController without repository dependencies. The controller must be properly initialized with repositories before use in production.

    • AuthController

      public AuthController(StudentRepository students, CompanyRepRepository reps, CareerCenterStaffRepository staff)
      Creates an AuthController wired to the given repositories and seeds default password entries from their contents.

      Automatically populates the password map with default entries ("password") for all users found in the provided repositories.

      Parameters:
      students - student repository for student account authentication
      reps - company representative repository for rep account authentication
      staff - career center staff repository for staff account authentication

  • Method Details

    • seedDefaults

      public void seedDefaults(StudentRepository students, CompanyRepRepository reps, CareerCenterStaffRepository staff)
      Populates the internal password map with default entries for loaded users.

      For each user found in the repositories, creates a default password entry with the value "password". Existing entries are preserved (not overwritten).

      Parameters:
      students - student repository containing student accounts
      reps - company representative repository containing rep accounts
      staff - career center staff repository containing staff accounts

    • login

      public String login(String loginKey, String password)
      Attempts to authenticate a user by ID or email and returns a role-qualified key on success.

      The authentication process:

      1. Validates input parameters
      2. Determines user type based on login key format (email vs ID)
      3. Verifies account exists and is approved (for company reps)
      4. Checks password against stored value
      Company representatives must be approved by staff before they can log in.
      Parameters:
      loginKey - ID or email used to identify the account
      password - password attempt
      Returns:
      role-qualified principal string in the format "ROLE:identifier" (e.g., "STUDENT:U1234567A", "COMPANY_REP:rep@company.com")
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when credentials are invalid, account not found, or company representative account is pending approval
      IllegalStateException - if authentication system is not properly initialized

    • changePassword

      public void changePassword(String loginKey, String oldPw, String newPw)
      Changes a user's password after verifying the existing password.

      Validates that:

      • All input parameters are provided and non-empty
      • The current password matches the stored value
      • The new password is not the default "password" value
      • The user account exists in the system
      Parameters:
      loginKey - ID or email of the user
      oldPw - current password for verification
      newPw - new password to set
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when validation fails, passwords don't match, or user not found
      IllegalStateException - if authentication system is not properly initialized

    • verify

      public boolean verify(String loginKey, String password)
      Verifies credentials without throwing exceptions; returns true on match.

      This is a silent version of the login method that returns a boolean instead of throwing exceptions for invalid credentials. Useful for validation checks where exception handling is not desired.

      Parameters:
      loginKey - ID or email
      password - password attempt
      Returns:
      true when credentials are valid and account exists, false otherwise
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if authentication system is not properly initialized

    • getUserRole

      public AuthController.Role getUserRole(String loginKey)
      Returns the inferred role for the given ID or email, or null if not found.

      Determines user role based on:

      • Email format (@ symbol) indicates company representative
      • Student ID format indicates student
      • Staff ID format indicates career center staff
      Parameters:
      loginKey - ID or email to look up
      Returns:
      corresponding Role if user exists, null if not found
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if authentication system is not properly initialized
